DOC.brief_summary: Study evaluate Prostate Artery Embolization treatment low urinary track symptom due Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia Prostate Size Greater Than 90 Grams .
DOC.brief_title: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia Prostate Size Greater Than 90 Grams
DOC.detailed_description: This phase II , single center , prospective , single arm , investigational study evaluate safety efficacy prostate artery embolization ( PAE ) treatment severe low urinary tract symptom ( LUTS ) relate BPH patient prostate size great 90 gram either refuse surgical treatment consider poor candidate traditional surgical therapy . 30 patient enrolled single treatment arm follow-up le 12 month . The study involve screen period patient eligibility determine . Once eligibility confirm , patient receive PAE Embosphere Microspheres within 4 week screen transrectal ultrasound . After treatment , patient return follow-up visit 1 month , 3 month , 6 month , 12 month post PAE . At visit , patient complete IPSS IIEF questionnaire , undergo physical exam , perform medication review . Repeat TRUS urodynamic testing perform 6 month 12 month post PAE follow-up visit .
DOC.criteria: Patient age 5085 year Patient sign informed consent Patient experience low urinary tract symptom ( LUTS ) least 1 year prior study enrollment Patient prostate size large 90g measure transrectal ultrasound ( TRUS ) Patient IPSS score great equal 13 Patient peak urine flow rate < 12 mL/sec Patient either : Refuses surgical treatment Is consider high risk surgical treatment Patient either : Refractory medical treatment Contraindicated medical treatment Patient must meet ONE follow criterion : Baseline PSA ≤ 2.5ng/mL Baseline PSA > 2.5 ng/mL ≤ 10 ng/mL AND free PSA ≥ 25 % total PSA ( biopsy require ) Baseline PSA > 2.5 ng/mL ≤ 10 ng/mL AND free PSA < 25 % total PSA AND negative prostate biopsy result ( minimum 12 core biopsy ) within 12 month Baseline PSA > 10 ng/mL AND negative prostate biopsy result ( minimum 12 core biopsy ) within 12 month History prostate bladder cancer , currently evaluate cancer History prostate bladder cancer , currently evaluate cancer Patient take alpha blocker within 4 week screen Patient experience irregular voiding pattern despite medical management stable 5alpha reductase inhibitor dosage 3 month long History open prostate surgery , radiofrequency , microwave therapy Previous open bladder rectosigmoid colon surgery TURP within last two year Patient nodularity induration detect upon digital rectal examination ( DRE ) Neurogenic bladder neurological disorder impact bladder function Urethral stricture , bladder neck contracture , potentially confound bladder pathology , bladder disease , confound urethral pathology Acute urinary retention require indwell catheter Bladder atonia Active prostatitis urinary tract infection Cystolithiasis within past 3 month Serum creatinine > 1.7mg/dL Coagulation disturbance normalize medical treatment Iodinated contrast allergy control 24hour steroid preparation History gelatin allergy History pelvic irradiation History severe peripheral vascular disease know major iliac arterial occlusive disease History smoking great 30 packyears Interest future fertility Significant cardiac respiratory disease Investigator believe put patient risk complication procedure Any risk
